experiences.title: Senior Software Engineer / Staff Software Engineer
Tech Lead, Senior UI/UX Developer
experiences.description: I was hired at WGU as the first UI developer on a new UI/UX team. WGU had a student portal that was built on older technologies and wasn't able to scale. I was tasked with moving the front-end to a more scalable solution for future student growth.
descriptionBullets: Introduced new technologies such as AngularJS, Sass, GruntJS.
Created centralized and re-usable GruntJS based development stack with necessary tools needed for a wide variety of tasks.
Built Sass centric CSS framework of reusable components to achieve a consistent brand for the students.
Rebuilt student portal with AngularJS and orchestrated multiple applications and parallel releases for minimal impact on the business.
Architected deployment processes, and server architecture for front-end related files.
Orchestrated front-end move to service oriented architecture with minimal impact to the students.
Interviewed candidates for open UI developer positions.
Implemented code reviews and standards among the team.
Introduced and trained on unit tests in JavaScript
Trained other developers in related technologies as needed.

experiences.title: Frontend Developer
experiences.description: As a front-end developer at Clearlink I worked on several sites and brands. This allowed me to quickly iterate on new skills and techniques in the industry.
descriptionBullets: Introduced Sass as a CSS tool to help with large CSS projects.
Created an elegant product search and checkout process for AT&T services.

experiences.title: Web Applications Developer
experiences.description: During my time as a web applications developer for the BYU Chemistry Department I was able to work on several exciting projects. I was initially hired as a PHP developer to help maintain several PHP based applications. I was cross trained in Django and spent most of my time with that technology stack. During my time I was able to work closely with several faculty members to gather requirements, develop, test, and gather feedback.
descriptionBullets: Supported custom Drupal modules for department needs.
Learned Django and wrote several applications with it for faculty members.
Worked closely with faculty to gather requirements, test, and improve applications.

projects.name: Coaster Wall
projects.description: CoasterWall was one of my ultimate side projects. The site was a place to share theme park centered desktop pictures. It allowed users to upload images, crop them, and tag them for others to see. It was a lot of work and fun project to work on. It featured an admin panel with an email alert system to approve all new uploads from users.

projects.name: Digital Nurse Practitioner Software
projects.description: For our capstone project we worked with the graduate nursing program of BYU. We worked with them as a client to solve the issue they had with massive amounts of paper documents. We built a digital nurse practitioner evaluation platform for the project. This allowed necessary parties to create, complete, and review evaluation forms. We also provided the ability to view items offline as needed when traveling to locations without an internet connection.
